title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: BRAVE Day at Talawanda High School is our annual family building and diversity event for our Sophomore class. The focus of the day is on making students realize that they are not alone at Talawanda, and they have many other peers and adults that care about and support them. Our students are a large part of our community, and by sharing stories, participating in activities, and most importantly - listening - they realize the important role they play with their classmates. Since 2009, BRAVE Day has been an influential part of our Anti-bullying, personal empowerment program at THS and our students come out of this experience better people for it.The event will take place…FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 14TH The effort that our students put into the day is an amazing thing to witness. Not only do students participate, they also encourage each other throughout the day on a level that is not normally seen in a typical High School. As a School District we appreciate their willingness to let go of their normal day and try to become a better person. Talawanda is thankful for them, and realizes that we have some of the most caring students around.If you feel your student would not benefit from the day, or would be negatively affected by the activities provided, they are not required to attend. We will not force students to participate, but rather want to provide the opportunity for them to improve as Talawanda students during BRAVE Day. They should stay in class during the event if they do not want to attend.

summary: **BRAVE Day** is Talawanda High School's annual family building and diversity event for **sophomores on Friday, November 14th**. The program focuses on anti-bullying and personal empowerment by helping students realize they're not alone through story-sharing, activities, and listening to peers. Students are encouraged but not required to participate—those who choose not to attend should stay in their regular classes during the event.

title: FCCLA Hosts Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: FCCLA is honored and excited to once again host the Veteran’s Day breakfast and assembly. If you are a Veteran, please RSVP at this link and join us on November 11th!

summary:
FCCLA is hosting the **Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly** on **Tuesday, November 11, 2025** at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, OH 45056). 

- **Breakfast:** 7:30 AM
- **Assembly:** 9:00 AM
- All veterans and one guest are invited

**RSVP required:** Scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch, and total number attending. Event is sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS and RSVP approved for contribution.

title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
PUSH Program
PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

summary: The **PUSH Program** provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, contact Jeanne or Sabrina at **513-523-8100** or visit [push-oxford.org](http://www.push-oxford.org/).

source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

List of all Butler County food pantries

summary:
Talawanda School District provides several food assistance resources for families:

- **Little Free Pantries** are available 24/7 outside every TSD building and are restocked weekly or as needed
- **Backpack Program** provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays at all elementary buildings (contact your building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food Boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours
- View the [calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule](Calendar)
- Access a [list of all Butler County food pantries](List)
- Find the most up-to-date [SNAP information](SNAP information)

For assistance, contact your building's Social Worker listed in the Social Service Team section.

title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary:
**Individual Testing (12/3-12/5):** For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking the class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

**Class Testing (12/16-12/19):** Only for students currently enrolled in Algebra C or Government classes, administered during exam week. Make-up testing available 1/7-1/8.

Emails with specific test requirements and details will be sent to students and parents before Thanksgiving Break. Questions should be directed to Mrs. Hess at hessb@talawanda.org.

summary:
**Weekly club meetings November 3-7:**

- **Monday, Nov 3**: Diversity Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 400), Setting Stone (2:30pm, room 320), Tribune (2:30pm, room 315)
- **Tuesday, Nov 4**: NO SCHOOL for students; Mock Trial (5:00-7:00pm, room 315)
- **Wednesday, Nov 5**: Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412, all welcome)
- **Thursday, Nov 6**: Best Buddies (Tutorial, Cafeteria), Chess Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 603), Key Club (Tutorial, room 218), Mock Trial (5:00-7:00pm, room 315), Project Green (2:30-3:30pm, room 224), Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412)
- **Friday, Nov 7**: Drama (2:30-5:30pm, PAC)

Additional regular meetings: Mondays in room 400 and Tuesdays in room 400.

title: FCCLA Blood Drive - November 7th
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary: **FCCLA is hosting a blood drive on November 7, 2025, from 8am-12pm at Talawanda High School Auxiliary Gym.** The event addresses the American blood shortage and helps those needing blood for illnesses, transplants, and other medical needs. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate, and participants will receive free snacks and a 1-hour rest period after donating. The blood drive is TSD approved for distribution. For more information, contact +513-273-3200 or croucherk@talawanda.org.
